results.title: Asking Around
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Richard Greenhalgh, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.

results.title: The Voorman Problem
results.creator_credit: Baldwin Li, Mark Gill, Alastair Connolly and Honlodge
results.brief_description: Doctor Williams, a psychiatrist, is called to a prison to examine Voorman – an inmate with a peculiar affliction – he believes he is a god. The problem is, though, that he’s managed to convince the rest of the prison population that he is indeed telling the truth.

results.title: Good Night
results.creator_credit: Una Gunjak, Muriel D'Ansembourg, Eva Sigurdardottir, Blindeye Films and London Film School
results.brief_description: Rachel and Chloe are done with being innocent 14-year-olds. They head into town on a secret night out, dressed way beyond their years and oozing a sexuality they barely own.

results.title: Tumult
results.creator_credit: Maya Maffioli, Johnny Barrington, Rhianna Andrews, Channel 4 Television, Young Films (UK) and Creative Scotland
results.brief_description: A tribe of Norse warriors traipse across a barren land after battle. Bloodied and wounded, their chief is near death. He is about to hand over power to his son when a completely different kind of army descend upon them.

results.title: Here to Fall
results.creator_credit: Jim Agnew, Kris Kelly, Evelyn McGrath, Blacknorth, Arts Council (Ireland) and Irish Film Board
results.brief_description: A girl falls through darkness. A signal is broadcast, it’s a call. City wires connect and vibrate. The digital signal holds her, dropping her to a city’s rooftops that builds around her. She recognises it, and she’s safe, but for how long?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Agnew, Kris Kelly, Evelyn McGrath, Blacknorth, Arts Council (Ireland) and Irish Film Board

results.title: Abuelas
results.creator_credit: Katherine Lee, Afarin Eghbal, Kasia Malipan and National Film and Television School (Great Britain)
results.brief_description:
Between 1976 and 1983 Argentina was under a military regime that launched a campaign of terror (now known as the ‘Dirty War’) in which 30,000 people ‘disappeared’.
Among them were children and pregnant women. An estimated 500 babies were born in concentration camps. Whilst the mothers were killed, the children were adopted out, in many cases to military families.
For over 30 years, the ‘Las Abuelas de Plaza de la Mayo’ (‘Grandmothers of the Plaza de Mayo’) have been campaigning to recover these lost grandchildren. Since 2011 over 100 have been found and regained their true identities.
The Abuelas continue to search for the rest.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Katherine Lee, Afarin Eghbal, Kasia Malipan and National Film and Television School (Great Britain)

results.title: Two and Two
results.creator_credit: Anthony Bairstow, Babak Anvari, Kit Fraser and Flick Art
results.brief_description: In a school governed by a strict regime, the pupils are informed that what they had always been taught as fact is no longer true. But when the incredulous students speak out, they are forced to question how far they will go to stand up for their beliefs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony Bairstow, Babak Anvari, Kit Fraser and Flick Art

results.title: Pitch Black Heist
results.creator_credit: John Maclean, Gerardine O'Flynn, Film4, UK Film Council and DMC Film
results.brief_description: Liam (Liam Cunningham) and Michael (Michael Fassbender) are professional safe crackers who meet on a simple job to relieve an office safe from its contents. The catch is a light-activated alarm system.

results.title: Only Sound Remains
results.creator_credit: Aliocha Allard, Pierre-Alain Giraud, Arash Ashtiani, Anshu Poddar and London Film School
results.brief_description: In the wake of the violent post-election protests in Iran, a man and his wife, Babak and Nahid, try to hide the devastating news from Babak’s grandmother that his brother is missing.
